org.jamwiki.db

Class AnsiQueryHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamwiki.db.AnsiQueryHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    QueryHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CacheQueryHandler, DB2400QueryHandler, DB2QueryHandler, H2QueryHandler, HSqlQueryHandler, MSSqlQueryHandler, MySqlQueryHandler, OracleQueryHandler, PostgresQueryHandler, SybaseASAQueryHandler

    public class AnsiQueryHandler
extends Object
implements QueryHandler
    Default implementation of the QueryHandler interface for retrieving, inserting, and updating data in the database. This method uses ANSI SQL and should therefore work with any fully ANSI-compliant database.

    • Method Detail

      • authenticateUser

        public boolean authenticateUser(String username,
                                String encryptedPassword,
                                Connection conn)
                         throws SQLException
        Description copied from interface: QueryHandler
        Retrieve a result set containing all user information for a given WikiUser.
        Specified by:
        authenticateUser in interface QueryHandler
        Parameters:
        username - The login of the user record being retrieved.
        encryptedPassword - The encrypted password for the user record being retrieved.
        conn - A database connection to use when connecting to the database from this method.
        Returns:
        true if the login and password matches an existing user, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        SQLException - Thrown if any error occurs during method execution.

      • autoIncrementPrimaryKeys

        public boolean autoIncrementPrimaryKeys()
        Description copied from interface: QueryHandler
        Some databases support automatically incrementing primary key values without the need to explicitly specify a value, thus improving performance. This method provides a way for the a query handler to specify whether or not auto-incrementing is supported.
        Specified by:
        autoIncrementPrimaryKeys in interface QueryHandler
        Returns:
        true if the query handler supports auto-incrementing primary keys.

      • connectionValidationQuery

        public String connectionValidationQuery()
        Description copied from interface: QueryHandler
        Returns the simplest possible query that can be used to validate whether or not a database connection is valid. Note that the query returned MUST NOT query any JAMWiki tables since it will be used prior to setting up the JAMWiki tables.
        Specified by:
        connectionValidationQuery in interface QueryHandler
        Returns:
        Returns a simple query that can be used to validate a database connection.

      • existenceValidationQuery

        public final String existenceValidationQuery()
        Return a simple query, that if successfully run indicates that JAMWiki tables have been initialized in the database. This method should not be overridden as it is directly invoked by the DatabaseConnection.testDatabase(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, boolean) method and should thus be used in its base class form for all databases.
        Specified by:
        existenceValidationQuery in interface QueryHandler
        Returns:
        Returns a simple query that, if successfully run, indicates that JAMWiki tables have been set up in the database.

      • formatStatement

        protected String formatStatement(String sql,
                                 Object[] params)
        In rare cases a single statement cannot easily be used across databases, such as "date is null" and "date is not null". Rather than having two separate SQL statements the statement is instead "date is {0} null", and a Java MessageFormat object is then used to modify the SQL.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL statement in MessageFormat format ("date is {0} null").
        params - An array of objects (which should be strings) to use when formatting the message.
        Returns:
        A formatted SQL string.

      • lookupTopicByType

        public Map<Integer,String> lookupTopicByType(int virtualWikiId,
                                             TopicType topicType1,
                                             TopicType topicType2,
                                             int namespaceStart,
                                             int namespaceEnd,
                                             Pagination pagination)
                                      throws SQLException
        Description copied from interface: QueryHandler
        Retrieve a list of all topic names of a given type within a virtual wiki.
        Specified by:
        lookupTopicByType in interface QueryHandler
        Parameters:
        virtualWikiId - The virtual wiki id for the virtual wiki of the topics being retrieved.
        topicType1 - The topic type (image, normal, etc) for the topics to be retrieved.
        topicType2 - The topic type (image, normal, etc) for the topics to be retrieved. Set to the same value as topicType1 if only one topic type is needed.
        namespaceStart - The minimum namespace ID value for the result set. This parameter provides a way to use the same queries to return results from all namespaces or from only a single namespace.
        namespaceEnd - The maximum namespace ID value for the result set. This parameter provides a way to use the same queries to return results from all namespaces or from only a single namespace.
        pagination - A Pagination object that specifies the number of results and starting result offset for the result set to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        A map of topic id and topic name for all topic names of a given type within a virtual wiki, and within the bounds specified by the pagination object. If no results are found then an empty list is returned.
        Throws:
        SQLException - Thrown if any error occurs during method execution.

This method will return only non-deleted topics and performs better for cases where a caller only needs to know if a topic exists, but does not need a full Topic object.
